page.title: 13A WALK IN CUFFLEY.
page.content: We left school and walked along to the public footpath. the path was quite muddy so we wore boots. Beside the stream stinging nettles thrive so we had to be careful. Walking on we saw the hawthorn bush with its tiny white flowers. Now we came to an iron gate with a gap at the side for people to walk through.By the gap was a young hazel tree with new leaves.Through the gap by the gate we saw fields of winter wheat. There was a grass strip ahead of us to walk on.As well as the crop,many small flowers or weeds grow dead nettles with their small pink flowers,yellow dandelions,and cat's eyes-small blue flowers really known as speedwell.We saw a muntjac deer and the yellow celandine. By the stream is a pussy willow,here we stood to view the viaduct(a local landmark) and the neighbouring village of Northaw.
